page.title: 01The Vale E of Petersfield.
page.content: The area lying at the foot of the northern slopes of the South Downs half way between Midhurst and Petersfield is one of outstanding natural beauty. The gently undulating landscape is extensively cultivated with a fairly even mix of dairy and arable farming. Inspite of this an agreeable amount of mainly deciduous woodland has been preserved to provide cover for game. The River Rother forms an attractive feature in the NE corner of the area. The population is centred in and around the two villages of Nyewood and Trotton and in the sprinkling of houses dotted along the minor roads which traverse the block. The area contains five farms but other an agriculture and its associated activities in Midhurst & Petersfield, these 2 towns linked by the A272 also provide the only shops, services and
